rComments: Everything you need to know for the course is on the very detailed lecture slides that she posts. You could probably get away with skipping a good deal of class so long as you keep up with those. I found her pretty generous on marks for tests, but the labs can be hard because the marks are solely dependent on the accuracy and precision of your data

She's amazing. Clear, explains everything well and is an easy marker. Tests are straight forward and fair if you study. They focus on the concepts (no calculations at all), focus purely on lecture material and have choices of questions, so you don't have to study every single thing. However, labs are tough, take a while to complete and marked hard.

Weekly 30min quizzes, & lab reports every week. Problem sets once a month, & 2 midterms. 4 hr labs where your mark is solely on accuracy to accepted values (no subjectivity). The prof made my lab partner cry during a discussion, she  expects you to know all theory behind experiments, & barely gives any instructions/guidance. Decent lectures though.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework']
